channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Gleision: Call for inquest into mining disaster 10 years on
item.description: The families of four miners who died when water flooded the Gleision drift mine say questions remain.

item.title: Gleision: The mining disaster that was quietly forgotten
item.description: It's 10 years since the Gleision mining disaster, which claimed the lives of four men.

item.title: Day care centres: Reduced hours affecting disabled adults, carers say
item.description: Sian Thomas's mother says her total care hours have been reduced from 39 a week to six.

item.title: Covid: Swansea Bay health board advises return of school Covid rules
item.description: Rising Covid cases see secondary schools in one area asked to reintroduce some Covid measures.

item.title: Pennies back in production as cash is hoarded during Covid
item.description: No new 1p coins were made by The Royal Mint in 2018 and 2019 but returned to production last year.

item.title: Bute Park attack: Appeal for man who may have information
item.description: Police say he has done nothing wrong but could help inquiries into the fatal attack on Gary Jenkins.

item.title: Nicholas Burton: Family of killer's victim stunned by release claim
item.description: The brother of Nicholas Burton's victim says a claim he will be released in 2022 is "outrageous".

item.title: Cardiff docks novel makes Booker Prize shortlist
item.description: Novels set in Sri Lanka and South Africa, Cardiff Bay and the outer cosmos are among the nominees.

item.title: Covid Wales: Go-ahead for boosters and jabs for 12-15 year olds
item.description: Both will start next week, with care residents and front-line NHS workers first in line for boosters.

item.title: Welsh Labour and Plaid Cymru in Senedd co-operation talks
item.description: Parties confirm discussions on whether they can work together in the Welsh Parliament.

item.title: Social care: Services in Wales to get £48m for Covid recovery
item.description: It comes as experts warn over 1,000 people are blocking hospital beds due to a care worker shortage.

item.title: Anthony Hampton: Councillor denies 'abhorrent' child abuse claims
item.description: Former teacher Anthony Hampton denies abusing four children between the 1970s and 1990s.

item.title: Gleision: 'Guilt of surviving mine disaster with me forever'
item.description: A decade on from the Gleision mine disaster, two men who survived still carry the weight of the tragedy.

item.title: Carers: 'Going to the day centre is our break'
item.description: Carers fear day centres for disabled adults could be closed during a council's review of services.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Eluned Morgan announces booster jab plan
item.description: Eluned Morgan explains the Covid vaccination plans for 12 to 15-year-olds and the over-50s.

item.title: 'There's no emergency service for mental health'
item.description: Mental health specialists say people do not know where to turn, so are calling the police.

item.title: The Snowdonia bogs attracting rare birds back to Wales
item.description: Curlews and golden plovers have returned to marshland after not being seen since the 1990s.

item.title: Glyn Summers fall death: Family 'can't rest' without answers
item.description: Glyn Summers' family are calling for a full public inquiry.

item.title: Wales' World Cup qualifiers to be shown live on BBC Cymru Wales
item.description: Wales' 2023 Women's World Cup qualifying games will all be shown live by BBC Cymru Wales.

item.title: Wales and New Zealand match declared a sellout
item.description: Wales' autumn international against New Zealand in Cardiff on 30 October is declared a sellout.

item.title: Russell Martin: Swansea City boss expected to go through 'pain' at Championship club
item.description: Head coach Russell Martin says he knew there would be "pain" after taking charge at Swansea City as he tries to make his mark at the Championship club.

item.title: Grimsby Town 3-1 Wrexham: Ryan Taylor sets Mariners on course
item.description: Ryan Taylor, Luke Waterfall and Max Wright goals keep Grimsby's unbeaten start to the season going as they see off big-spending Wrexham.

item.title: Newport County 0-1 Northampton Town: Jon Guthrie gives Cobblers the edge
item.description: Jon Guthrie scores the only goal as Northampton Town win at Newport County to move into League Two's top three.

item.title: Galw am gwest i drychineb pwll glo Gleision wedi 10 mlynedd
item.description: Teuluoedd pedwar fu farw yng nglofa Gleision yn 2011 yn dweud bod cwestiynau i'w hateb o hyd.

item.title: Brechu plant 12-15 a brechiad pellach i rai dros 50
item.description: Mae gwaith yn mynd rhagddo eisoes, a bydd rhai yn derbyn pigiadau o'r wythnos nesaf ymlaen.

item.title: Llafur a Phlaid Cymru yn ceisio dod i gytundeb
item.description: Mewn datganiad ar y cyd, dywed y ddwy ochr y bu "trafodaethau dechreuol adeiladol".

item.title: Llyfr Mawr y Plant yn 90 oed
item.description: Dathlu pen-blwydd rhai o hoff gymeriadau Cymru gan gynnwys Siôn Blewyn Coch a Wil Cwac

item.title: Y Gynghrair Genedlaethol: Grimsby 3-1 Wrecsam
item.description: Mae'r golled yn golygu fod gan Wrecsam naw pwynt o'u chwe gêm hyd yma y tymor hwn.
